metadata.Title: CVE-2022-33070 on Ubuntu 23.10 (mantic) - medium
metadata.Description:
Protobuf-c v1.4.0 was discovered to contain an invalid arithmetic shift viathe function parse_tag_and_wiretype in protobuf-c/protobuf-c.c. Thisvulnerability allows attackers to cause a Denial of Service (DoS) viaunspecified vectors.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-33070` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libprotobuf-c1 - 1.4.1-1ubuntu1
protobuf-c-compiler - 1.4.1-1ubuntu1
No subscription required

libnss-sudo - 1.9.11p3-1ubuntu2
sudo - 1.9.11p3-1ubuntu2
sudo-ldap - 1.9.11p3-1ubuntu2
No subscription required

criterions.comment: libgadu package in mantic is affected and may need fixing.
pidgin package in mantic is affected and may need fixing.
protobuf-c package in mantic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1.4.1-1ubuntu1').
libpg-query package in mantic is affected and may need fixing.
sudo package in mantic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '1.9.11p3-1ubuntu2').
argyll package in mantic is affected and may need fixing.
libsignal-protocol-c package in mantic is affected and may need fixing.
ocserv package in mantic is affected and may need fixing.
